body:
Hi,

Is there a snippet, to receive incoming messages? And how can I that put in the SQL database?

comment_data.body:
Hi, you only need put the connection to the db into the function fired for the event get messages and make the apropate insert...

Saludos Jesús Sales

> El 28/03/2014, a las 12:34, MJ1994 <notifications@github.com> escribió:
> 
> Hi,
> 
> Is there a snippet, to receive incoming messages? And how can I that put in the SQL database?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

Haha, a little bit :)

And how to call the function, when I load the page?
Incoming messages are processed by pollMessage() and pollMessages() which automatically call the function for each message.
Yes I know, I have another file with the details to make SQL connection, and have that included in the page where I have placed the above mentioned code, but it doesnt work..

Well, In many times I have a problem with the connections into a functions, then I make a function where make a connections with globals variables and into a new function I call the connection function, try this... But what is the problem that you have at now???

Saludos Jesús Sales

> El 28/03/2014, a las 14:04, MJ1994 <notifications@github.com> escribió:
> 
> Yes I know, I have another file with the details to make SQL connection, and have that included in the page where I have placed the above mentioned code, but it doesnt work..
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
Can you send a message to your test number, set $debug=true and then run your script?

Done, message is received and this is the text on the page:

![log](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7090370/2550043/da7e6e8c-b67e-11e3-9495-a291dfac82e4.png)
But the message is not inserted into database?
Nope :-( I have checked all the columns in the database and that is correct, and (mysql_error()); doesn't give failures..

Try to include the connection just over of insert, into the function and writte mysql_query(....) or die(mysql_error());

If not insert,  the error will be written

Saludos Jesús Sales

> El 28/03/2014, a las 14:48, MJ1994 <notifications@github.com> escribió:
> 
> Nope :-( I have checked all the columns in the database and that is correct, and (mysql_error()); doesn't give failures..
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

The same that I mentioned before... I'm sure that the problem is there

Saludos Jesús Sales

> El 28/03/2014, a las 14:53, Max Kovaljov <notifications@github.com> escribió:
> 
> Try to import the global connection identifier:
> 
> in your connect include script
> 
> $conn = mysql_connect($foo, $bar, $baz);
> and in the event handler:
> 
> {
>     ...
>     global $conn:
>     mysql_query($query, $conn) or die(mysql_error($conn));
> }
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

...
please don't open SQL connections in the event handler :')

So you just need to fix your credentials for MySQL.

And add an "or die(mysql_error())" after your mysql_connect() call in your include.
Done, but no text with failures
And what are the failures?
No failures.. Haha. No text with failures.. :P But no entries in database..
How about you just run a test script to see if you can actually insert stuff into your table before we continue guessing what the problem might be.

Pufff!!! The error is because you need to connect to database from the function, when you call a function nothing that not exist into the function exist, a function is another world into other, please into the function make a connection to database and later make a query...

Saludos Jesús Sales

> El 28/03/2014, a las 15:11, MJ1994 <notifications@github.com> escribió:
> 
> Done, but no text with failures
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

@shirioko Yes I try. 

By the way, in the rule '$conn = mysql_connect($foo, $bar, $baz);', where does he select the db?

You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'from, id, type, time, name, data) VALUES ('SENDER', 'RECEIVER', 'ID984', ' at line 1

Can it be that one of 'from, id, type, time, name, data' is a reserved keyword in SQL?

Probably. You can wrap your field names in special quotes (on the ~ key)
```
`from`, `time` etc.
```
And you have to either select database using mysql_select_db('databasename', $conn) or specify it in your query as 'database'.'table'

I have editted the name of the columns and run the other script, for testing.

The error "You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'from, id, type, time, name, data) VALUES ('SENDER', 'RECEIVER', 'ID984', ' at line 1" is now gone, its fixed.

Also have editted the names in the other script, for save incoming messages, but no results..
Works fine for me. Are you on the latest code?

I thought one for the send message and one for the receiving messages, but one is sufficient?

It works now, huray!

I have another question: At the whatsapp.php, when I open it you can search for a number/group. I saw this in the file:


/**
 *
 * NOTHING ELSE TO EDIT BELOW THIS LINE.
 *
 */
require 'whatsprot.class.php';

/**
 * For the future, other ways of getting contacts from various sources
 * can be used by implementing the Contacts Interface.
 *
 *
 * Data must be returned in an array that looks like follows:
 *
 * Array
 *
 * (
 *   [0] => Array
 *       (
 *           [name] => PersonName
 *           [id] => 1234567890
 *       )
 *
 *   [1] => Array
 *       (
 *           [name] => PersonName2
 *           [id] => 0987654321
 *       )
 * )
 */


It is then the intention that I do that arrays in that same file? Of for example, I must be making a contacts.php and including that into that file?
No, the intention for that is to use data sources like Google or CSV files.

Aha okay. I am making a online alert-system for my region, and I want to make that users can insert their number in the system. But its not possible that the script is searching a sql table for numbers, when I search at 'Choose a person/group..' ?
Sure, as long as your MySQL connector class implements the Contacts interface and returns the numbers in the format described above.

Shirioko, thank you very much for the examples and help...I have been have similar issues and thanks to your examples all is working fine. Can you please tell me what the easiest way would be to insert received image url into mysql db using your above examples for text messages?

title: Receive messages
